name: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at Hilton Hawaiian Village

reviews.text: My husband whom is a Marine went to a conference and I went along with him. We decieded to stay there because of the pictures that showed the Hilton as beautiful and the location with views. I was amazed at how beautiful everything was when we checked in....thought wow this will be a great vacation. Went up to our room 1614 in the Rainbow Tower :(.......and was very dissapointed at it. Now the view was beautiful and amazing. They had us in the Tapa Tower but, we wanted to up grade to a ocean view.....maybe we should of stayed in the Tapa.
reviews.title: Beautiful place....needs some TLC in rooms

reviews.text: Room----needs some updating that is for sure. The bathroom has no fan, mold in ceiling, back of toilet had a crack in it, plug in the wall was not even screwed in the wall.....and couldnt adjust the shower head. The bathroom smelled for the entire week. There we stains on the wallpaper, the bottom drawer in the dresser had to be lifted up to be shut. I had to call down and ask for the cleaning lady to change our sheets on day 4......I mean you could clearly see that they needed to be changed but, I had to call.....did not vacuum the entire time either.
reviews.title: Very large, but nice resort

reviews.text: The grounds were beautiful and there was alot to do. Between the pools, shops, beach...fish, birds, peguins and flamingos.
reviews.title: Huge but nice!

reviews.text: We did have a view of the Luau for 5 nights which was nice. :)
reviews.title: Place to stay in Waikiki with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very pricey to eat there. We did eat at Noodles a Japanese little quick and cheap eatery. We had the pizza to it was very good. $10 for a mixed drink at the pool & had to wait for 30 min for my change....she didnt get a tip.
reviews.title: Termites, ewww

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hilton Hawaiian Village is kinda like going to Disneyland....clean, pretty, crowded & pricey. We stayed at the Grand Vacations Club for 4 nights & the rooms were very nice, not too large but Ok & we had a nice view of the city. We then stayed in the Hilton Hawaiian Village hotel (the Ali'i Tower) & had a very nice ocean view.
reviews.title: Nice-but.................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: Spotless, nice pools, convienent location, excellent service, free internet access at the Grand Vacation Club, in room coffee maker, decent food, beautiful grounds, penguins(!!), right on the beach with a small lagoon, the Ali'i tower has its own smaller pool with access limited to that tower only
reviews.title: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Lagoon Tower at Hilton Hawaiian Village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: pools are unheated, charge for EVERYTHING...ie: internet access at the hotel & the most outrageous charge of all? If you want 2 chairs & an umbrella at the beach (& the hotel is ON the beach), it will cost $90.00 per day....YES NINETY DOLLARS!!!!....through the hotel!!!!, the included continental breakfast for elite status members was very limited,
reviews.title: Perfect Beginning for our Trip

reviews.text: We're owners so we were upgraded to a very nice, clean, 2 balcony suite, with better view than what we had originally reserved (the mattresses were too soft. It's like a mini city, where the resort is huge, nicely landscaped, but you can ignore the upscale stores if you want to. There are ABC stores where you can buy groceries if you want to cook in the kitchen, but the foodstores are close by. Restaurants and lower price stores are available right outside the resort.
reviews.title: Hawaii at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Italian restaurant on the premises had a great Mom's Day dinner with wine pairing. The wines were not fantastic but the overall experience was fun. We enjoyed our stay there, but we rented a car, parking is $24/day, and traveled all around the island.
reviews.title: Fantastic Christmas Escape

reviews.text: We go to Hawaii every year or so and like to start our stay on Oahu. This year I took my parents, wife, and kids and we all stayed at the HHV Lagoon tower. The 2BR suite was spacious and comfortable with a great layout for a '3 generations' vacation. Having the services of the Hilton was very convenient - room service, valet parking, etc. One day we sent our kids to the Camp Penguin (which they loved) and got an adult day to ourselves. We also liked having the dining and shopping options of the village nearby for those days we just stayed at the hotel to enjoy the beach and pools.
reviews.title: Lagoon Tower - Great for families, great location
A week of full enjoyment
reviews.text: The location is great because you have Waikiki beach - warm and calm - outside your door. Ala Moana's shopping/dining is walkable in one direction while the Waikiki restaurants (e.g Keo's) are walkable in the other. And most of Oahu (Hanauma Bay, Portlock, Kaimuki, the Pali, downtown, etc) is a short drive away.
In short, there is no place on Oahu I'd rather stay with a family.
reviews.title: Concrete and sand

reviews.text: Wow where to start?? from the shows,food or wonderful view..all can say is thank you for a time well spent...i came back home well relaxed, and just in aww of all the beauty that we exsperianced there..thanks!
reviews.title: A perfect week in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A massive hotel consisting of a series of high rises overlooking a small beach. Any room overlooking the pool is likely to be plagued by noise especially on weekend nights. If your idea of a beach vacation consists of high rise buildings surrounding you this is the place for you. Otherwise, avoid this and any of the other Waikiki 'resorts'.
reviews.title: Staying anywhere else would be a downgrade
Good choice in Waikiki with kids
reviews.text: Stayed in Kalia Tower 1Br for a week. The rooms are very nice, clean, comfortable king bed in the bedroom and the kids did fine on a pull-out sofa in the living room. The tower is not that far from the pools and beach, and very close to the ABC store and restaurants in the marketplace. It is also right across the street from Wailana Coffee House which was good and cheap for breakfast/lunch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best parts: - wide beach in front of the hotel, with a reef just in front for easy snorkeling; - Paradise Pool slides for kids; -beatifull hotel grounds with parrots, flamingos, penguins, koi fish, turtles. Also free Wi-Fi and gym usage for those staying in timeshare units.
reviews.title: What a ripoff

reviews.text: Worst: - expensive food/drinks in most restaurants onsite (although ABC Store is a reasonable option; -towel stands are only open 8-4:30 or 5pm so you have to save towels for evening swims.
reviews.title: What a let down.

reviews.text: Overall it was a good choice for staying in a true resort with kids in Waikiki.
reviews.title: I own an ocean view here BUT we've had our share of let downs...

reviews.text: I purchased a 1 bedroom Condo fpr my Honeymoon in 2006 for $23,000.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations Club At Hilton Hawaiian Village Hotel
description: When staying at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at Hilton Hawaiian Village®, you'll have access to the Village's spectacular amenities, including an exercise facility to maintain your workout routine, over 20 restaurants and lounges, complimentary shows and live events, first-class shopping and a wide variety of activities the whole family will enjoy. Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at Hilton Hawaiian Village® offers studios, one and two bedroom suites.
